main event: A round, orange-colored unidentified flying object was sighted in Macon, Georgia, on multiple occasions in August 1952.
interesting points: The object was first noticed at sunset and appeared to be moving toward the observer., Through binoculars, the observers could see a distinct outline of a saucer shape., The object receded into the distance, appearing smaller until it could no longer be seen., Multiple individuals, including military personnel, reported seeing the object around the same time., One observer described the object as a huge light bulb, reddish-orange in color, and identical in shape to a flat circular object.
witness description: observers included a husband and wife team as well as military personnel from Robins Air Force Base
